title: 3 scientists win Nobel Prize in medicine for discoveries in immunology
description: Nobel Prize committee chair says discoveries by the trio of researchers were "decisive for our understanding of how the immune system functions."

title: Supermoon will appear tonight. Here's what to know.
description: The first supermoon of 2025 will arrive soon. Here's what to know about the phenomenon.

title: Supermoon will appear tonight. Here's what to know.
description: The first supermoon of 2025 will arrive soon. Here's what to know about the phenomenon.

title: Mysterious planet is gobbling 6 billion tons of gas and dust a second
description: ESO's Very Large Telescope has observed a rogue planet and revealed that it is eating up gas and dust from its surroundings at a rate of 6 billion tons a second.

title: Mysterious planet is gobbling 6 billion tons of gas and dust a second
description: ESO's Very Large Telescope has observed a rogue planet and revealed that it is eating up gas and dust from its surroundings at a rate of 6 billion tons a second.

title: Saturn's moon shows favorable conditions for life: "Simply phenomenal"
description: Enceladus has long been considered a prime candidate in the search for life beyond Earth because of its hidden ocean and plumes of water erupting from cracks near its south pole.

title: From the archives: Naturalist Jane Goodall
description: Famed naturalist Jane Goodall, who dedicated her life to studying chimpanzees and protecting the environment, died on Wednesday, Oct. 1, 2025 at age 91. In this Oct. 24, 2021 "Sunday Morning" profile, she talked with Seth Doane about her fascination with animals, her groundbreaking work with primates, and her advocacy for a more sustainable future.

title: Bermuda braces for Hurricane Imelda after a brush with Humberto
description: The outer bands of Humberto lashed Bermuda ahead of a more direct pass from the newer and stronger Hurricane Imelda.

title: Why crickets are as good as a thermometer
description: The chirping of crickets in your backyard can be a soothing seasonal sound, but did you know it's also an accurate way to tell the temperature – if you know the mathematical formula? Robert Krulwich and puppeteer Barnaby Dixon explain.

title: Million-year-old skull could rewrite human evolution timeline
description: The findings have the potential to resolve the longstanding "Muddle in the Middle" of human evolution, researchers said.

title: Sub discovers unexploded Nazi bombs teeming with marine life
description: The study's author said "there is some irony" in the discovery that these "things that are meant to kill everything are now attracting so much life."

title: Galaxy's largest star formation captured in never-before-seen detail
description: Sagittarius B2, a massive molecular cloud near the center of the Milky Way, is densely packed with stars and complex magnetic fields.

title: Space weather satellites blast off to collect information on solar storms
description: A SpaceX rocket lifted off Wednesday from the Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, carrying NASA's Interstellar Mapping and Acceleration Probe, or IMAP.

title: Breaking down the science of anthropomorphism
description: Scientist and professor Justin Gregg joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss his new book, "Human-ish: What Talking to Your Cat or Naming Your Car Reveals About the Uniquely Human Need to Humanize." He explains why we talk to pets, name objects, and even connect with inflatable tube men — and what that reveals about human nature.

title: Newly discovered dinosaur had a crocodile leg in its jaws
description: The new find was possibly 23 feet long and hailed from a mysterious group of dinosaurs called megaraptorans.

title: NASA introduces 10 new astronaut candidates
description: The new selection of NASA astronauts will spend two years in training before becoming eligible for flight assignments.

title: NASA introduces newest astronaut recruits
description: NASA on Monday introduced its 10 newest astronaut candidates. They represent America's future in space, wherever in the cosmos that leads. Mark Strassmann has more.

title: Flesh-eating bacteria kills 5th person this year in Louisiana
description: Vibrio vulnificus is a bacteria that occurs in warm coastal waters and can be contracted through raw seafood or open wounds.

title: Prehistoric insects trapped in amber give glimpse into ancient life
description: Scientists have discovered prehistoric insects preserved in amber in South America for the first time.

title: Northrop Grumman cargo ship reaches space station after software fix
description: The capture by the International Space Station's robot arm came a day late because of an unexpected, but now resolved, software issue.

title: Cygnus cargo ship set to rendezvous with space station after delay
description: This comes after two planned engine firings shut down prematurely, NASA said, putting the Cygnus cargo ship's approach to the space station on hold.

title: Wild chimps consume the equivalent of 2 cocktails a day, research finds
description: A new study on chimpanzees in Uganda and Côte d'Ivoire supports a theory that humans may have inherited a taste for alcohol from primate ancestors.

title: NASA says solar activity is increasing: "The sun is slowly waking up"
description: The sun has become more and more active over the last 16 years, in a turn that surprised scientists and could affect space weather, NASA said.

title: Smoke-dried remains found in Asia may be world's oldest mummies
description: Some ancient societies in Asia appear to have smoke-dried their dead, effectively mummifying them thousands of years earlier than their Egyptian counterparts, new research has found.

title: Northrop Grumman cargo ship heads for space station
description: The upgraded Cygnus spacecraft is carrying more than 5 tons of equipment and supplies, including holiday food for the lab's crew.

title: The significance of Mars rover's latest discovery
description: This week, NASA said scientists took the biggest step yet toward discovering whether there was ever life on Mars when a rock sample collected by the Mars rover Perseverance contained potential biosignatures, which could suggest ancient signs of life. Douglas Jerolmack, a professor of Earth and environmental science at the University of Pennsylvania, discusses the significance of the discovery.

title: Mars rover uncovers strongest hints yet of potential signs of ancient life
description: NASA's Mars rover Perseverance has uncovered rocks in a dry river channel that may hold potential signs of ancient microscopic life.

title: Mars rover uncovers strongest hints yet of potential signs of ancient life
description: NASA's Mars rover Perseverance has uncovered rocks in a dry river channel that may hold potential signs of ancient microscopic life.

title: Rocks found on Mars may hold potential signs of ancient life
description: NASA's Mars rover Perseverance has uncovered rocks in a dry river channel that may hold potential signs of ancient microscopic life, according to scientists. Mark Strassmann reports.

title: Rocks found on Mars may hold potential signs of ancient life
description: NASA's Mars rover Perseverance has uncovered rocks in a dry river channel that may hold potential signs of ancient microscopic life, according to scientists. Mark Strassmann reports.

title: NASA scientists probe Earth-like planet for atmosphere, water
description: Exoplanet TRAPPIST-1 e may contain an atmosphere and liquid water, NASA scientists said. Research into the exoplanet is ongoing.

title: Iguana shocks zookeepers with "virgin birth" of 8 hatchlings
description: "When we confirmed the eggs were fertile without any contact with a male, our jaws hit the floor," a U.K. zoo director said after an iguana gave birth to eight healthy babies.

title: Blood moon rises during total lunar eclipse. See the photos.
description: A blood moon rose in the night sky this week, offering a dazzling celestial event for people across multiple continents.

title: Tail of interstellar comet is growing, new telescope image shows
description: Astronomers in Chile captured a new image of comet 3I/ATLAS on its journey across the inner solar system.

title: Northern lights might be visible across 18 states tonight
description: People in 18 U.S. states could see the green or red glow of the aurora in the sky Monday night into Tuesday.

title: "Punk rocker" dinosaur had long spikes, newly discovered fossils show
description: "Spicomellus is one of the strangest dinosaurs that we've ever discovered," the project's leader said.

title: SpaceX launches giant Super Heavy-Starship rocket on critical test flight
description: SpaceX launched its huge Super Heavy-Starship on Tuesday, chalking up what appeared to be a remarkably successful test flight in the wake of three back-to-back failures​ earlier this year.

title: Village swallowed by the sea 8,500 years ago found off Denmark
description: Divers have collected evidence of a Stone Age settlement lost to rising seas after the last ice age from the seabed off Denmark's coast.

title: SpaceX resets Super Heavy-Starship's 10th test flight again, for tonight
description: SpaceX hopes to pick up the pace with Super Heavy-Starship test flights amid concern the rocket may not be ready in time for a planned 2027 moon landing.

title: SpaceX cargo ship brings needed supplies to space station
description: Along with delivering needed supplies and equipment, the Dragon features a "boost kit" to help raise the space station's altitude.

title: World's first commercial carbon storage facility gets first CO2 injection
description: The first commercial carbon storage facility has been inaugurated off Norway's coast, but is storing CO2 deep under the seabed really the answer?

title: SpaceX reschedules Super Heavy-Starship test flight after ground systems issues
description: Taking no chances, SpaceX called off an attempt to launch its huge Super Heavy-Starship rocket after running into problems with ground equipment.

title: SpaceX launches 33rd cargo delivery mission to the International Space Station
description: SpaceX sent up a Dragon capsule loaded with 2.5 tons of equipment and supplies, along with an add-on thruster kit to help maintain the lab's altitude

title: U.S. scientists work to preserve vulnerable species at a Smithsonian lab
description: Experts at the Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute care for endangered species on 32,000 sprawling acres in Northern Virginia.

title: SpaceX launches unpiloted X-37B spaceplane on classified mission
description: During its secretive mission, the X-37B will test new laser communications gear and a "quantum" navigation sensor.

title: Here's what the hurricane categories mean
description: The Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale​ rates hurricanes on a scale from 1 to 5.

title: Examining the meteorite that landed in a Georgia house up close
description: A meteorite appeared as a fireball seen in several states, including Georgia, where it landed in a house. Dave Malkoff explores its past.

title: ULA launches Vulcan rocket on first military mission
description: ULA's Vulcan is replacing the company's workhorse Atlas 5 rocket and the already-retired Delta 4 family of launchers.

title: Meteorite that ripped through Georgia home's roof is older than Earth
description: A mysterious fireball blazed across the sky in broad daylight on June 26, sparking hundreds of siting reports in Georgia and South Carolina.

title: Meteorite that ripped through Georgia home's roof is older than Earth
description: A mysterious fireball blazed across the sky in broad daylight on June 26, sparking hundreds of siting reports in Georgia and South Carolina.

title: Space station astronauts return to Earth after 5-month mission
description: The splashdown off San Diego closed out a 148-day mission for two NASA astronauts, a Japanese flier and a Russian cosmonaut.

title: Jim Lovell, Apollo 13 commander, dies at age 97
description: Astronaut Jim Lovell circled the moon on Apollo 8 and helped bring Apollo 13 home safely despite a mishap far from Earth.

title: 4 space station fliers undock, head for Saturday splashdown
description: Crew 10 is the first NASA-sponsored crew that will land in the Pacific Ocean. All previous NASA Crew Dragon flights ended with splashdowns off the Florida Gulf coast or the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Astronaut Jim Lovell recalls dangerous Apollo 8 mission
description: Fifty years ago, a Saturn V rocket carried humans on a journey to the moon for the first time. Astronaut Jim Lovell was on that mission, and he shared his memories of it with CBS News national correspondent Chip Reid.

title: New image shows high-speed comet visiting from another solar system
description: Discovered last month by a telescope in Chile, the comet known as 3I-Atlas is only the third known interstellar object to pass our way.

title: Scanning the heavens at the Vatican Observatory
description: Perched in the hills outside Rome sits the Palace of Castel Gandolfo, the centuries-old lakeside summer home for popes, which is also home to the Vatican Observatory, established in 1891 to help bridge the chasm between religion and science. Correspondent Seth Doane talks with scientists and students for whom the Church's observations of the heavens are a means to unite people beyond faith.

title: NOAA could face 25% budget cut, slashing climate research, in draft proposal
description: An internal government document proposes significant changes for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration​, hitting its research functions hardest.

title: New Vulcan rocket takes off on second test flight
description: Despite an apparent problem with one of two strap-on boosters, the Vulcan reached orbit and otherwise performed as expected.

title: Jane Goodall on her hope for the future
description: At age 87, the famed naturalist who has dedicated her life to protecting wildlife and the environment continues to advocate for a more sustainable future, as she writes in "The Book of Hope: A Survival Guide for Trying Times."

title: Jane Goodall: If humans don't change "we're going to destroy ourselves"
description: The world-renowned conservationist desperately wants the world to pay attention to what she sees as the greatest threat to humanity's existence.
